member.value: A value indicating whether the message is signed.

remarks.p: Signers of a signed message are accessible through collection. The signature can be validated using method or removed using method. It is created using method.
Please note that messages that are encrypted might also be signed, but because the signature itself is also encrypted as well, this fact will not be known until the message is decrypted.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailMessage.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the message is encrypted.
member.value: A value indicating whether the message is encrypted.

remarks.p: Recipients of an encrypted message are accessible through collection. The message can be decrypted using method. To encrypt a message, use method.
Until an encrypted message is decrypted, its content is inaccessible.

remarks.p: This property specifies the agent responsible for the transmission of the message. Use to specify the list of authors of the message.
This field must be set if the '' field contains multiple authors.
This field should not be set if the ' field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailMessage.EnvelopeId
member.summary: Gets or sets the envelope identifier to be transmitted along with the message and included in any DSNs issued.

remarks.p: The purpose of the envelope identifier is to allow the sender of a message to identify the transaction for which the DSN was issued.
Please note that the envelope ID is not a part of a mail message and is not saved with it. Its purpose is to be used while sending the message.
Envelope ID must be an ASCII string up to 100 characters in length. Characters < 33 and character '+', '=' and character 127 are represented as three characters.

member.summary: Ignore the MIME tree and parse the message as a single-level entity.

member.summary: Parse and reencode all headers, even when not needed or modified.

member.summary: Ignore unparsable headers when parsing mail message.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.AlwaysWriteContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: Always write the content-transfer-encoding, even if it has default value of "7bit"

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.IgnoreUnparsableSignatures
member.summary: Ignore unparsable S/MIME signature entities when parsing mail message.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.DoNotQuoteProblematicSequences
member.summary: Disable encoding of leading 'F', '.' and '-' character in body parts using quoted-printable content transfer encoding. These leading characters used to cause problems to legacy mail transfer agents, so quoted-printable-encoding them was used as a workaround that doesn't cause any problems to properly-implemented mail agents.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.OnlyParseHeaders
member.summary: Only parse message headers and ignore the body.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.DoNotAddDateIfNoSubjectAndFrom
member.summary: Do not automatically add a date header if 'date', 'subject' or 'from' headers are missing from a top-level or embedded message.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.DisableEncryptionKeyPreference
member.summary: Do not include encryption key preference attribute in signed message attributes.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.DisableSMimeCapabilitiesAttribute
member.summary: Do not include S/MIME options attribute in signed message attributes.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.SkipCertificateUsageCheck
member.summary: Skip certificate usage check.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.IgnoreInvalidTnefMessages
member.summary: Ignore invalid TNEF (winmail.dat) attachments when parsing mail message.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.SkipSenderCheck
member.summary: Skip sender check.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.DisableSinglePartHtmlWorkaround
member.summary: Disable a workaround for broken mail clients such as Mac mail that don't correctly parse HTML-only messages. By default, MailMessage class constructs a single-part multipart/alternative structure to solve this. This property turns off this behavior.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.LoadMsgProperties
member.summary: Load Outlook MSG properties into custom MIME headers. All these MIME headers start with X-Outlook- string.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.SkipTnefMessageProcessing
member.summary: Skip TNEF (winmail.dat) attachment processing. If specified, the 'winmail.dat' attachment is not processed at all.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.PreferExplicitBody
member.summary: Prefer BodyText and BodyHtml to be taken from its original .msg message fields. Default is false, which means BodyText and BodyHtml are taken from BodyRtf if possible (if embedded).

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.RtfMode
member.summary: The mode to process RTF in mails.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.IgnoreMsgTransportHeaders
member.summary: Ignore TransportMessageHeaders field when loading .msg file. If set to true, some fields are taken directly from the .msg structure instead of the TransportMessageHeaders field. The affected fields are: Sender, From, To, CC, Bcc, Subject, Date, MessageId. Any MIME headers stored in TransportMessageHeaders field are not loaded either.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailSettings.TreatMixedInlineAsAttachment
member.summary: Treat sub-entities of 'multipart/mixed' as attachments even if their Content-Disposition is 'inline'.

member.name: T:Rebex.Mail.RtfProcessingMode
member.summary: The mode to process RTF mails.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mail.RtfProcessingMode.Default
member.summary: Convert RTF to HTML and discard the RTF in case of successful conversion. In case of unsuccessful conversion, the RTF is kept as attachment (with the "X-Rebex-RTF-Body" header set). This is the default behavior.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mail.RtfProcessingMode.TreatAsAttachment
member.summary: RTF is not converted into HTML and is always treated as attachment. The appropriate "X-Rebex-RTF-Body" header is set.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mail.RtfProcessingMode.Legacy
member.summary: Legacy mode that turns on the legacy behavior. RTF is converted to HTML and kept either as Attachment (for binary RTF's) or as AlternateView (for non-binary RTF's). In case that RTF is added as attachment, then the "X-Rebex-RTF-Body" header is set.

member.summary: Gets or sets the file name of the attachment.

member.remarks: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2183#section-2.3

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.Headers.ContentDisposition.ReadDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the read date of the attachment. This parameter is rarely used.
member.value: The read date of the attachment. Null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if not specified.
member.remarks: The read-date parameter MAY be used to indicate the date at which the file was last read. If the read-date parameter is included, the parameter value MUST be a quoted-string which contains a representation of the last-read date of the file in [RFC 822] `date-time' format. https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2183#section-2.6

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.Headers.ContentDisposition.CreationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the creation date of the attachment. This parameter is rarely used.
member.value: The creation date of the attachment. Null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if not specified.
member.remarks: The creation-date parameter MAY be used to indicate the date at which the file was created. If this parameter is included, the paramter value MUST be a quoted-string which contains a representation of the creation date of the file in [RFC 822] `date-time' format. https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2183#section-2.4

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.Headers.ContentDisposition.ModificationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the modification date of the attachment. This parameter is rarely used.
member.value: The modification date of the attachment. Null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if not specified.
member.remarks: The modification-date parameter MAY be used to indicate the date at which the file was last modified. If the modification-date parameter is included, the paramter value MUST be a quoted-string which contains a representation of the last modification date of the file in [RFC 822] `date-time' format. https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2183#section-2.5

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.Headers.ContentDisposition.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the approximate size of the attachment. This parameter is rarely used.
member.value: The approximate size of the attachment. Null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if not specified.
member.remarks: The size parameter indicates an approximate size of the file in octets. It can be used, for example, to pre-allocate space before attempting to store the file, or to determine whether enough space exists. https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2183#section-2.7

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeEntity.Preamble
member.summary: Gets or sets the preamble of this multipart entity.

remarks.p: Preamble is only used for multipart entities.
Preamble is a block of text preceding the first part of a multipart entity. It is usually used to store a short explanatory notice for non-MIME compliant user agents to display.
Default value is "This is a multipart MIME message."
The preamble is only used for multipart entities.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeEntity.Epilogue
member.summary: Gets or sets the epilogue of this multipart entity.

remarks.p: Epilogue is only used for multipart entities.
Epilogue is a block of text following the last part of a multipart entity. It might be used to store a message that non-MIME compliant user agents will display.
Default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage.EnvelopeId
member.summary: Gets or sets the envelope identifier to be transmitted along with the message and included in any DSNs issued.

remarks.p: The purpose of the envelope identifier is to allow the sender of a message to identify the transaction for which the DSN was issued.
Please note that the envelope ID is not a part of a mail message and is not saved with it. Its purpose is to be used while sending the message.
Envelope ID must be an ASCII string up to 100 characters in length. Characters <33 and character '+', '=' and character 127 are represented as three characters.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority of the message.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the origination date of this message.
member.remarks: The origination date specifies the date and time at which the creator of the message indicated that the message was complete and ready to enter the mail delivery system.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage.From
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of authors of this message.

remarks.p: This property specifies the the list of authors of the message.
If this field contains multiple authors, the '' field must be set to specify the agent responsible for the transmission of the message
If this field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message, the '' field should not be set.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage.Sender
member.summary: Gets or sets the sender of this message.

remarks.p: This property specifies the agent responsible for the transmission of the message. Use to specify the list of authors of the message.
This field must be set if the '' field contains multiple authors.
This field should not be set if the ' field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message.

member.name: T:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions
member.summary: Specifies various options for MIME parser and writer.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotWriteBcc
member.summary: Do not write the "Bcc" header into output stream.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotParseMimeTree
member.summary: Ignore the MIME tree and parse the message as a single-level entity.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.ProcessAllHeaders
member.summary: Parses and reencodes all headers, even when not needed or modified.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.IgnoreUnparsableHeaders
member.summary: Ignore unparsable headers when parsing mail message.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.AlwaysWriteContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: Always write a content-transfer-encoding, even if it has a default value of "7bit"

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.IgnoreUnparsableSignatures
member.summary: Ignore unparsable S/MIME signature entities when parsing mail message.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.AllowAnyTextCharacters
member.summary: Skips checking of text content for text/* entities. When this options is enabled, it is possible to use any characters inside text entities.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotQuoteProblematicSequences
member.summary: Disables encoding of leading 'F', '.' and '-' character in body parts using quoted-printable content transfer encoding. These leading characters used to cause problems to legacy mail transfer agents, so quoted-printable-encoding them was used as a workaround that doesn't cause any problems to properly-implemented mail agents.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.OnlyParseHeaders
member.summary: Only parses message headers and ignores the body.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotAddDateIfNoSubjectAndFrom
member.summary: Do not automatically add a date header if 'date', 'subject' or 'from' headers are missing from a top-level or embedded message.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DisableEncryptionKeyPreference
member.summary: Do not include encryption key preference attribute in signed message attributes.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DisableSMimeCapabilitiesAttribute
member.summary: Do not include S/MIME options attribute in signed message attributes.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.SkipCertificateUsageCheck
member.summary: Skip certificate usage check.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.IgnoreInvalidTnefMessages
member.summary: Ignore invalid TNEF (winmail.dat) attachments when parsing mail messages.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.SkipSenderCheck
member.summary: Skip sender check.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.KeepRawEntityBody
member.summary: Keep the raw entity body when parsing MIME messages and make it accessible using .

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotCloseStreamAfterLoad
member.summary: Keep the input stream open when method is done.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotPreloadAttachments
member.summary: Try to conserve memory by not preloading attachment content when constructing a message.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DisableSinglePartHtmlWorkaround
member.summary: Disable a workaround for broken mail clients such as Mac mail that don't correctly parse HTML-only messages. By default, MailMessage class constructs a single-part multipart/alternative structure to solve this. Enabling this flag turns off this behavior.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.LoadMsgProperties
member.summary: Load Outlook MSG properties into custom MIME headers. All these MIME headers start with X-Outlook- string.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotTrimHeaderValues
member.summary: Instructs the MIME header parser not to trim the headers while parsing them.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DisableRtfToHtmlConversion
member.summary: Do not convert RTF views to HTML.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.TreatBinaryRtfAsAlternateView
member.summary: Treat binary RTF as AlternateView.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.SkipTnefMessageProcessing
member.summary: Skip TNEF (winmail.dat) attachment processing. If specified, the 'winmail.dat' attachment is not processed at all.

member.name: T:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding
member.summary: Type of transfer encoding of the content.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown content encoding.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Quoted-Printable encoding.
member.remarks: The Quoted-Printable encoding is intended to represent data that largely consists of octets that correspond to printable characters in the US-ASCII character set.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.Base64
member.summary: Base64 encoding.
member.remarks: The Base64 encoding is designed to represent arbitrary sequences of octets in a form that is not humanly readable.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.SevenBit
member.summary: No encoding, content data is 7bit.

remarks.p: 7bit data refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences. No octets with decimal values greater than 127 are allowed and neither are NULs (octets with decimal value 0). CR (decimal value 13) and LF (decimal value 10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.EightBit
member.summary: No encoding, content data is 8bit.
member.remarks: 8bit data refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences. Octets with decimal values greater than 127 may be used. CR (decimal value 13) and LF (decimal value 10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.Binary
member.summary: No encoding, content data is binary.
member.remarks: Binary data refers to data where any sequence of octets is allowed.
